NoteLiteral.En:
Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card/passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol for the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page). 

B2 level of English language proficiency is required.

Description.En: The first working laser was demonstrated in 1960, and afterward, the development of intense light sources has evolved rapidly opening a variety of possibilities for applications starting from the laser scanners in shops or laser printers in offices and ending with extremely intense and short duration (down to attoseconds, 10-18s) pulsed light sources for groundbreaking research. The importance of the laser-related research field was acknowledged by several Nobel prizes in Physics given for the development of the laser itself and more recently for advances in pulsed laser development via chirped pulse amplification method and laser applications like manipulation of micro-objects. This micro-module is devoted to attendees interested in emerging technologies in photonics and does not require more than basic knowledge of physics. In this micro-module, you will learn the principles of laser operation and will find out the variety of application possibilities of ultrafast laser sources in scientific research as well as in commercial products. You’ll be able to explain why ultra-short laser pulses are necessary for creating high-tech products.

Title.En: Describe the application limits of the theories explaining the nature of light

NoteLiteral.En: Students will be able to differentiate which effects related to light interaction with the material can be described using ray, wave, electromagnetic or quantum theories.

Title.En: Interpret working principles of continuous wave and pulsed lasers

NoteLiteral.En: The selection of laser working parameters is crucial to apply these devices for different applications. Students will be able to select between different lasers available in the market taking in mind the field of application.

Title.En: Describe the nonlinear and ultrafast phenomena

NoteLiteral.En: Students will be able to discern nonlinear processes taking place in material during the interaction with the laser radiation.

Title.En: Choose laser processing parameters for micro-/nano- processing of material surfaces and in the bulk

NoteLiteral.En: Students will be able to choose the laser processing parameters in case of subtractive or additive manufacturing.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
Learners will take part in the following activities:  video lectures, readings, tests, practical tasks, discussions, online assessments. 

Each week students will find a video lecture, teaching material and practical tasks and self-evaluation quizzes. After finishing the task of the week, the further learning material will become available. 

The material needed for the studying is provided in the course page. 

Evaluation will be based on continuous assessment of problem-solving tasks, self- and peer-evaluation, mid-term and final assessment marks. 

[Syllabus of the micro-module](https://uais.cr.ktu.lt/ktuis/stp_report_ects.mdl_ml?p_kodas=MM00M127&p_year=2024&p_lang=EN&p_stp_id=)
Ignite the laser emission and light up the pathways for its emerging applications

Lithuania is known as a country with a strong background in laser physics. Currently, Lithuania accounts for more than half of the global market of pico-second laser spectrometers. The recent progress in pulsed lasers unleashed innovative fabrication and characterization technologies which helped to establish related new product markets. The expansion of laser utilization in consumer electronics production and even biomedicine demands an understanding of the basic laser operation principles. This micro-module aims to explain the advantages of pulsed lasers, peripheral products, and related new technologies.

Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card/passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol for the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page). 

B2 level of English language proficiency is required.
